update.description:
We have some cool examples, but they tend to get out of date. I've created a regression test that builds several example plugins that are used in gazebo tutorials. My grand plan (#951) is to include the example code in the gazebo wiki directly from bitbucket, to reduce copy and paste errors and also ensure that the examples on the wiki are regression tested.

I've fixed four broken example plugins in this pull request. It is easy to add tests for new plugins (see example_plugins.cc), but I will save that for one of our testing parties.

UPDATE: I updated the test file to use the gtest machinery for parameterized tests to make it a little more concise. Plugins can be added to the test by adding a single line.

EDIT: Most of the fixes for the examples were copied directly from the wiki. The wiki has seen much more maintenance than our examples folder.

UPDATE: The temporary build folders are now removed at the end of each test.
update.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

content.raw: a part from this, they work perfectly fine for me. congrats!
content.html: a part from this, they work perfectly fine for me. congrats!

pull_request.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

pullrequest.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

content.raw: This test falls under the category of regression, which is fine to me but I would like to be able to run (or exclude) them separately using a regexp. What about renaming them to just ```EXAMPLE_``` or something like this?
content.html: This test falls under the category of regression, which is fine to me but I would like to be able to run (or exclude) them separately using a regexp. What about renaming them to just EXAMPLE_ or something like this?

pull_request.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

pullrequest.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

content.raw:
Your are right, it will not test the the cmake/pkgconfig installation. But I'm not sure that it should be a goal for this kind of tests.

I agree with your second point, let's move on with this working approach, we could  improve it in the future if needed.
content.html:
Your are right, it will not test the the cmake/pkgconfig installation. But I'm not sure that it should be a goal for this kind of tests.

I agree with your second point, let's move on with this working approach, we could improve it in the future if needed.

pull_request.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

pullrequest.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

content.raw:
I'm open to that. This was an evolution from [another cmake test](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/8e39c39f6640bd8643a377130423c9182361362a/test/cmake/config-cmake.cc?at=default), and not a dramatic change.

I think we want the examples to be built after `make install` to verify that the cmake and pkg-config is working properly. Does that work for the `make examples` approach?

Again, I'm totally open to different implementations, but since this seems to be working now, that's one point in its favor.
content.html:
I'm open to that. This was an evolution from another cmake test, and not a dramatic change.

I think we want the examples to be built after make install to verify that the cmake and pkg-config is working properly. Does that work for the make examples approach?

Again, I'm totally open to different implementations, but since this seems to be working now, that's one point in its favor.

pull_request.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

pullrequest.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)

content.raw: Nice, great idea and really good implementation. I was thinking a bit more on the conceptual idea since it looks a bit weird to me to run cmake and make (configure and compilation steps) from a run step (a test run in this case). A different approach would be to incorporate the examples to the standard gazebo building system using a different target (```make examples```) and do not run it under a normal make, requiring to call ```make examples``` explicitly. @scpeters do you think that this could work, or I am missing something?
content.html: Nice, great idea and really good implementation. I was thinking a bit more on the conceptual idea since it looks a bit weird to me to run cmake and make (configure and compilation steps) from a run step (a test run in this case). A different approach would be to incorporate the examples to the standard gazebo building system using a different target (make examples) and do not run it under a normal make, requiring to call make examples explicitly. @scpeters do you think that this could work, or I am missing something?

pull_request.title: Create regression test that builds example plugins (part of #951)
